channel.title: Personal on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Startup Impact
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Startup Impact
channel.copyright: Text and figures licensed under [CC BY-NC-ND 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/) by [Yanir Seroussi](https://yanirseroussi.com/about/), except where noted otherwise

item.title: Keep learning: Your career is never truly done
item.description: Podcast chat on my career journey from software engineering to data science and independent consulting.

item.title: First year lessons from a solo expertise biz in Data & AI
item.description: Reflections on building a solo expertise business in Data & AI, focusing on climate tech startups. Lessons learned from the first year of transition.

item.title: Mentorship and the art of actionable advice
item.description: Reflections on what it takes to package expertise and deliver timely, actionable advice outside the context of employee relationships.

item.title: My experience as a Data Tech Lead with Work on Climate
item.description: The story of how I joined Work on Climate as a volunteer and became its data tech lead, with lessons applied to consulting & fractional work.

item.title: Atomic Habits is full of actionable advice
item.description: I put the book to use after the first listen, and will definitely revisit it in the future to form better habits.

item.title: The three Cs of indie consulting: Confidence, Cash, and Connections
item.description: Jonathan Stark makes a compelling argument why you should have the three Cs before quitting your job to go solo consulting.

item.title: New decade, new tagline: Data & AI for Impact
item.description: Shifting focus to ‘Data & AI for Impact’, with more startup-related content, increased posting frequency, and deeper audience engagement.

item.title: Psychographic specialisations may work for discipline generalists
item.description: When focusing on a market segment defined by personal beliefs, it’s often fine to position yourself as a generalist in your craft.

item.title: The lines between solo consulting and product building are blurry
item.description: It turns out that problems like finding a niche and defining the ideal clients are key to any solo business.

item.title: My rediscovery of quiet writing on the open web
item.description: Reflections on publishing on this website: Writing publicly to share thoughts and documentation beats chasing views and likes.

item.title: The Minimalist Entrepreneur is too prescriptive for me
item.description: While I found the story of Gumroad interesting, The Minimalist Entrepreneur seems to over-generalise from the founder’s experience.

item.title: Revisiting Start Small, Stay Small in 2023 (Chapter 2)
item.description: A summary of the second chapter of Rob Walling’s Start Small, Stay Small, along with my thoughts & reflections.

item.title: Revisiting Start Small, Stay Small in 2023 (Chapter 1)
item.description: A summary of the first chapter of Rob Walling’s Start Small, Stay Small, along with my thoughts & reflections.

item.title: You can't save time
item.description: Time can be spent doing different activities, but it can’t be stored and saved for later.

item.title: The mission matters: Moving to climate tech as a data scientist
item.description: Discussing my recent career move into climate tech as a way of doing more to help mitigate dangerous climate change.

item.title: My 10-step path to becoming a remote data scientist with Automattic
item.description: I wanted a well-paid data science-y remote job with an established company that offers a good life balance and makes products I care about. I got it eventually.

item.title: Ask Why! Finding motives, causes, and purpose in data science
item.description: Video and summary of a talk I gave at the Data Science Sydney meetup, about going beyond the what & how of predictive modelling.

item.title: The joys of offline data collection
item.description: Insights on data collection and machine learning from spending a month sailing, diving, and counting fish with Reef Life Survey.

item.title: The long road to a lifestyle business
item.description: Progress since leaving my last full-time job and setting on an independent path that includes data science consulting and work on my own projects.
